10/10

A game that clearly shows the developers wanted to make a masterpiece. The story follows many of the strengths of the original Bioshock, but goes even deeper than before. All too often games that deal in quantum physics and science fiction get lost plot holes and contrivances, but Bioshock Infinite welcomes speculation and the more you think about what's happening the more you respect all the details the writers added to the story. While there aren't too many permanent characters throughout the game, Elizabeth is easily one of the best written female characters in gaming. I couldn't possibly list half the things I loved about this game without spoiling it, but this is a game I could recommend to anyone.
 
Coming back to the actual mechanics of the game, the graphics are phenomenal. They run well on mid-range cards and rely on beautiful art design and animation to make Columbia one of the most beautiful venues in video games yet. The music is appropriate, but the rest of the sound design (in Bioshock fashion) is excellent, and many of the audio logs are simply chilling. Voice acting is for the most part top-notch. 

If I have a complaint about Bioshock infinite, it's in the combat. Enemy AI is fairly basic and enemy variety is a bit wanting. The vigors are nice, but not as varied or powerful as before. That being said, the setting is much more open and diverse than the previous games. Still, truth be told, I preferred the original game's combat a little bit. Nonetheless, while this isn't a "flawless" game, it is a masterpiece, and it will be looked back on as an important step in gaming. It shows that there are still developers out there who look to their game as a piece of art and are willing to push boundaries.

it good

One of the best narrative based fps games I have played. Once i got into it, which was fairly quick, I couldn't stop playing it until I finished it, I really enjoyed the mind blowing story and it's characters, and how although the story is to escort Elizabeth out of Columbia, there isn't one point where you have to worry about crappy escort missions. Get the Burial at Sea DLC as well as that mixes up the gameplay and goes into more detail on the story of Rapture and Columbia.

Just plain a great game. Combat can range from very easy to extremely tactical and quite tricky. It's a rudimentary system - two guns at once plus up to 8 powers, but a good one, and this game adds a vertical element to many fights. That's all there as a bonus, though, as the real point of this game is definitely its story, as two interesting characters make their way through a unique and deep world trying to figure out what the hell is going on. 

If you're allergic to anything political in your games, though, steer clear. Bioshock always has a message, and this is no different.

The PC version, as run on mid-range hardware, makes no such visual compromises, with gorgeous high-resolution textures, detailed faces, and smooth performanc.
It is fascinating, and also boring. It is important, yet forgettable. Its world is enticing and unappealing. It attempts to move things forward, yet is in places stuck in the past. For a game that has the potential to open up the franchise up to a multitude of different ideas and interpretations, BioShock Infinite can feel curiously limited. 
For me somethin between 7.5 or 8 /10

Man..

The game will take you about 11-13 hours, but you'll need to play it twice to soak it all in.

The shooting is fantastic.

The atmosphere is at first jovial, then it is heavy as you peel back the veneer and finally it crescendos to an electrifying final 3rd as all the forces make their move.

The writing is what you would expect from a [i] Bioshock [/i] game. It may seem convoluted to most players, but I've always viewed the universe of [i] Bioshock [/i] as their(Irrational Games) examination of the human psyche. "No Gods or Kings only man"[i] (Bioshock 1) [/i], but with all their freedom they were still bound to the same mental/tribalistic  "chains" they thought they had unshackled themselves from.

The setting. When I think about this the only thing that comes to mind is that [i] "The Stepford Wives" [/i] movie. Yes, that is it. You'll
be singing in the beginning and cussing before you're halfway through.

10/10. Would break a handyman's hand with my face again. Also, the Songbird is so supremely terrifying. It's size man.

Used to play this game so many times on the Xbox 360 when it came out and I fell in love with it but I kind of forgot it when my Xbox broke. Once I finally got a PC to run some games, I got this as soon as I saw it on summer sale and a whole world of nostalgia hit me, this game's graphics are amazing and hold up to a lot of newer games these days and I'm still impressed with the story line. I would recommend anyone who hasn't played it yet to buy it while it is on sale!

В общем, если вы любитель хороших сюжетов советую пройти эту игру. Но не проходите на высокой сложности!! Лучше уж на средней или легкой, поймите.
